    Sets the value of a cell in the board to a specified piece and updates the piece's current position.

    Assuming that a move is valid, determines if the move is castling.
    private static boolean Mover.tryMoveIsEnPassant​(Piece piece, int x, int y)
    Assuming that a move is valid, determines if the move is en passant.
    static boolean Mover.tryMovePiece​(Piece piece, int x, int y)
    Moves a piece if the move follows the rules of chess.

  • Uses of Piece in pieces

    Subclasses of Piece in pieces 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Bishop
    Chess piece that moves and captures diagonally.
    class  King
    Chess piece that can move to and capture the 8 cells adjacent to it.
    class  Knight
    Chess piece that moves to and captures cells positioned at an L-like path from it, specifically 2 rows and 1 column away, or 2 columns and 1 row away.
    class  Pawn
    Chess piece that can move 1 cell forward (or 2 on its first move) and captures one cell diagonally forward.
    class  Queen
    Chess piece that moves and captures diagonally, vertically, and horizontally.
    class  Rook
    Chess piece that moves and captures horizontally and vertically.
    Methods in pieces that return types with arguments of type Piece 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private java.util.Map<Piece,​java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>>> King.everyPieceValidMoves​(boolean onlyWhitePieces, boolean accountForCheck)
    Finds all valid moves of all pieces belonging to a player.
